content: Is there anybody to clarify the Device.partNumber? I cannot understand this element and its usage in FHIR.
it's the product code per the manufacturer's catalog.
"Part number" is a common expression - meaning the catalog part number, i.e. an identifier for the device
example of a part number reference in a safety notice : https://www.bfarm.de/SharedDocs/Kundeninfos/EN/11/2017/05409-17_kundeninfo_en.pdf?__blob=publicationFile&v=1

And then, at least in the US, there is the UDI, the unique, traceable, identifier to the device used for things like device recalls, calibration due, etc.
Device.udiCarrier
Part number can coincide with the DI part of the UDI
